channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sundry fly tipped rubbish, 24th December
item.description:
A washing machine and a sofa had been left out for bulky waste collection. Other residents took the opportunity to fly tip additional rubbish.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Middleton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Zebra crossing by wattisfield Road bus stop is dangerous, 24th December
item.description:
There is a zebra crossing between the bus stop and pavement over the cycle lane. It is a blind spot for the pedestrian trying to cross from bus stop side. I nearly got hit by an e bike as was unable to see around the bus shelter onto the bike path.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lea Bridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of dumped waste in the street, 24th December
item.description:
Many bags of rubbish and recycling, cardboard, etc. I think it's been there for 3 or 4 days.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ambleside Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins, 24th December
item.description:
This and at least two other things are full overflowing in their rubbish being blown across the park. Animals have been in there as well pulling food out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Footbury Hill Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped wheeled office chair, 24th December
item.description:
Dumped from a property on the blocked off section and getting moved around the street. Currently by bike hangers by large tree. North end. Also more dumped rubbish alongside rear of number 108 - bag/printer/etc. Thank you for clearing the overflowing brown bin and fridge from that area!

item.title: Bin permanently on pathway, 24th December
item.description:
Have reported this multiple times including REF 8566408 and REF 8553245 - both have been changed to fixed and have said that it would be resolved in the weekly cleanse. It has not been resolved. Big black bin is permanently in pathway and overflowing, and is a dangerous obstacle for pedestrians especially with the primary school next door. This bin has been on the pathway for months without moving outside number 104.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwood Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside dexter apartments, 24th December
item.description:
Multiple dog fouling all outside dexter apartments going up to the cafe . Very disgusting to see. Sickening to walk with children on this road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Queen's Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike left for over 8 months, 24th December
item.description:
The light Blue Bike has been left locked up for well over 8months. Staff at the restaurant infront of the lock can confirm. it takes up parking space for other cyclists and sometimes causes blockages on pavement

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
